issue.title: Reading single-band rasters: unified approach with multiband reader

milestone.title: Operational data pipeline
milestone.description: Iplement this workflow : Pre-processing new images ->storing COGs in the datacube -> run inference service in a hybrid Kubernetes (Rancher on AWS) and HPC (gpsc3) infrastructure

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
As operationalization approaches, inference.py will need to read and concatenate single band rasters rather than [multiband only](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/develop/inference.py#L120). This implies extending [sample_creation.py](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/develop/sample_creation.py)'s use to inference.py and possibly merging with [images_to_samples.py](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/develop/images_to_samples.py) (soon to become data_to_tiles.py --> #215 ). 

This issue is closely related to #221 and #222. A future reading utility will have to manage a list of rasters as input with variable configration (some may be multiband, others will be single-band, maybe even for a same training dataset). This utility will then be available for tiling as well as inference.

body:
> how to link the ground truth to this list?

There may be an answer in the [STAC Label](https://github.com/stac-extensions/label) extension.

issue.title: Inference module: build first unit tests

issue.body: The inference module needs prioritization to create unit tests. Among the tests, one will have to check the "reading from STAC item" feature from #222

issue.title: Inference: refactoring needed

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
In preparation of issues #222 and #223, some refactoring is needed:
- use get_key_def to convert to pathlib.Path objects and to check existence of files/directories
- restore state_dict input to usage before #208 
- tracker: create set_tracker function to remove block of lines about tracker in inference_segmentation.py
- remove unused functions
- a few more minor things.

issue.title: Refactor inference and apply refactoring to other scripts

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
This PR makes no major changes to functionality and is mostly aimed at cleaning out some lenghty pieces of code in preparation for #222 #223. Result: net loss of over 200 lines of code :)

closes #265 

- utils.py: add to_path and validate_path_exists in get_key_def() and use
- logger.py: create set_tracker() function and use
- utils.py: create set_device() function and use (also checks if model can be pushed to device)
- remove unused ruamel_yaml dependency and yaml reader function (irrelevant with hydra)
> read_parameters() function and ruamel_yaml have been temporarily added to old scripts like data_analysis (#138 ) and gdl_hyperopt_template (#243 ) but ruamel_yaml is removed from environment.yaml since current scripts no longer rely on it.

- inference_segmentation.py: no parameters from training cfg inside script (use hydra)
- augmentations: complete usage of hydra for dontcare value (remove dontcare2background)
- utils.py and more: clean out other unused functions, imports and parameters

issue.body:
necessary to start working on #222 and #215 

In files changed, see [environment.yaml](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/pull/275/files#diff-9efd195f4e9bfb79ccd456a1d8370fafcc4bcb0b00ea3799222667d2ae818533) only.

add dependency: torchgeo, pystac, solaris (v0.5.0), rio-stac
move pip dependencies to conda if possible
change channel priority (pytorch, then conda-forge)
remove secondary dependencies when possible
